values.description: no need to check if DDS/DigitalOut being attached since allowed children can only be Pseudoclock now.
values.title: Improved PulseBlaster add_device and removed extraneous DDS/DigitalOut check

summary.raw: no need to check if DDS/DigitalOut being attached since allowed children can only be Pseudoclock now.
summary.html: no need to check if DDS/DigitalOut being attached since allowed children can only be Pseudoclock now.

values.reason: The point of the code removed in this Pull Request was to inform the user that they are using the old style device hierarchy and should swap to the new style or that they don't need to instantiate a PseudoClock themselves for the PulseBlaster because it is already done for them. It isn't strictly necessary code, but I think it is important to have informative error messages when changing the Public API.

values.description: An instance attribute was referenced that did not exist. Using the value passed in as a method argument instead.
values.title: Fixed bug with PineBlaster BLACS code

summary.raw: An instance attribute was referenced that did not exist. Using the value passed in as a method argument instead.

values.description:
Fixed bug where any device based on PulseBlaster_No_DDS did not get labels on the front panel buttons in BLACS. 
This was because the change to the pseudoclock/clockline object hierarchy in labscript requires an extra method to be defined in the tab class as outputs are now more removed from the device the tab belongs to (no longer direct children)

fixes #9
values.title: Fixed missing front panel labels for PulseBlaster_No_DDS and subclasses

summary.raw:
Fixed bug where any device based on PulseBlaster_No_DDS did not get labels on the front panel buttons in BLACS. 
This was because the change to the pseudoclock/clockline object hierarchy in labscript requires an extra method to be defined in the tab class as outputs are now more removed from the device the tab belongs to (no longer direct children)

fixes #9
summary.html:
Fixed bug where any device based on PulseBlaster_No_DDS did not get labels on the front panel buttons in BLACS. This was because the change to the pseudoclock/clockline object hierarchy in labscript requires an extra method to be defined in the tab class as outputs are now more removed from the device the tab belongs to (no longer direct children)

fixes #9

values.description:
**Note: This is untested on actual hardware. I would appreciate if someone could test before merging!**

A new AnalogIn class has been created in NIBoard.py called NIAnalogIn. The signature of this class is backwards compatible with AnalogIn, and the defaults for the new keyword arguments (min/max) match those hard coded into the existing NI BLACS classes.
The NI classes with analog inputs have been updated to use the min/max values specified in the device properties of the NI card.

All changes are backwards compatible with the previous API and should maintain the original behaviour if no modifications are made to the labscript file.
values.title: Added support for configurable voltage range on NI analog inputs.

A new AnalogIn class has been created in NIBoard.py called NIAnalogIn. The signature of this class is backwards compatible with AnalogIn, and the defaults for the new keyword arguments (min/max) match those hard coded into the existing NI BLACS classes. The NI classes with analog inputs have been updated to use the min/max values specified in the device properties of the NI card.

All changes are backwards compatible with the previous API and should maintain the original behaviour if no modifications are made to the labscript file.

values.description:
Fixes #10, #11, #12

* Updated NI PCI 6733 device to add features and fix bugs

     * Fixed bugs in BLACS worker process preventing use of digital outputs in experiments
     * Fixed bug in labscript code which demanded an even number of child devices, not an even number of AnalogOuts
     * Fixed bug in labscript code which had the incorrect dtype for the digital output numpy array. This caused an obscure "index out of range" error in a bitfield conversion.

* Fixed NI PCI 6733 bugs in changeset 20443c0519a2

     * Fixed the return of final experiment values to the front panel (previously only worked if you had analog channels)
values.title: NI PCI 6733 Bug fixes

summary.raw:
Fixes #10, #11, #12

* Updated NI PCI 6733 device to add features and fix bugs

     * Fixed bugs in BLACS worker process preventing use of digital outputs in experiments
     * Fixed bug in labscript code which demanded an even number of child devices, not an even number of AnalogOuts
     * Fixed bug in labscript code which had the incorrect dtype for the digital output numpy array. This caused an obscure "index out of range" error in a bitfield conversion.

* Fixed NI PCI 6733 bugs in changeset 20443c0519a2

     * Fixed the return of final experiment values to the front panel (previously only worked if you had analog channels)
summary.html:
Fixes #10, #11, #12

  • Updated NI PCI 6733 device to add features and fix bugs

    • Fixed bugs in BLACS worker process preventing use of digital outputs in experiments
    • Fixed bug in labscript code which demanded an even number of child devices, not an even number of AnalogOuts
    • Fixed bug in labscript code which had the incorrect dtype for the digital output numpy array. This caused an obscure "index out of range" error in a bitfield conversion.

  • Fixed NI PCI 6733 bugs in changeset 20443c0519a2

    • Fixed the return of final experiment values to the front panel (previously only worked if you had analog channels)

values.title: Updated trigger_delay for pineblaster to a value that was actually measured with a CRO
Fixed bug where NI PCIe 6363 would always try and caculate some wait information even though it wasn't the wait_monitor.

values.description:
Also fixes issues with:
 * long delay instructions (the number of reps must be at least 2)
 * calculation of when to use a long delay instruction when using assymetric clock pulses
 * assymetric clock pulses don't make sense if it isn't used as a pseudoclock (now raises LabscriptError)

fixes #16

Chris: Can you verify this does not break the requirements you introduced for NIST.
values.title: Restores previous symmetric clock pulses as the default behaviour for the PulseBlaster (fixes #16)

summary.raw:
Also fixes issues with:
 * long delay instructions (the number of reps must be at least 2)
 * calculation of when to use a long delay instruction when using assymetric clock pulses
 * assymetric clock pulses don't make sense if it isn't used as a pseudoclock (now raises LabscriptError)

fixes #16

Chris: Can you verify this does not break the requirements you introduced for NIST.
summary.html:
Also fixes issues with: * long delay instructions (the number of reps must be at least 2) * calculation of when to use a long delay instruction when using assymetric clock pulses * assymetric clock pulses don't make sense if it isn't used as a pseudoclock (now raises LabscriptError)

fixes #16

Chris: Can you verify this does not break the requirements you introduced for NIST.

values.description:
This fix works on my system for my use case (a single wait before acquisition start), but has not been tested extensively. 

It should properly account for multiple waits that start both before and/or during an acquisition. I'm not 100% certain that is desirable functionality but I could envisage as use case for it. I could also see it being difficult to implement directly in the new NIDAQmx class.

Assuming all is well I'd be happy to update the other classes.
values.title: Fixes issue #19, where acquisition after wait is not handled properly

summary.raw:
This fix works on my system for my use case (a single wait before acquisition start), but has not been tested extensively. 

It should properly account for multiple waits that start both before and/or during an acquisition. I'm not 100% certain that is desirable functionality but I could envisage as use case for it. I could also see it being difficult to implement directly in the new NIDAQmx class.

Assuming all is well I'd be happy to update the other classes.

Assuming all is well I'd be happy to update the other classes.

to be able to run a shot with no hardware connected. Intended use case is for testing and
developing BLACS in the absence of hardware.

values.description:
* Added a check to allow for an error message when the maximum number of instructions is exceeded. The number can be configured in the constructor / ConnectionTable. For our Pulseblaster this is 4000, so I chose this as the default value.

* Close branch ReneKolb/Pulseblaster_MaxInstructions
values.title: Pulseblaster check MaxInstructions

summary.raw:

* Close branch ReneKolb/Pulseblaster_MaxInstructions

• Added a check to allow for an error message when the maximum number of instructions is exceeded. The number can be configured in the constructor / ConnectionTable. For our Pulseblaster this is 4000, so I chose this as the default value.

values.description:
I have added the generic NI class that we use at the JQI.  I also took the time to find all (most?) of the bug fixes that have been applied to other NI cards over the past year and get them into this class.  This change required a small number of changes to the NIboard class to give it instance rather than class level variables, and I also changed some variable names to be more consistent across the board.

This in turn required some changes in all of the remaining NI boards.   It is probable that I have introduced some bugs in the process of doing this, and I don't have ready access to hardware to test.

The syntax of this new class is:

```
from labscript_devices.NI_DAQmx import NI_DAQmx

NI_DAQmx(name='ni_pci_6733_0', parent_device=pulseblaster_0_ni_pci_clock,
        MAX_name='Dev1',
        clock_terminal='/Dev1/RTSI0', 
        num_AO=8,
        sample_rate_AO=700e3,
        num_DO=8,
        sample_rate_DO=2e6,
        num_AI=0,
        clock_terminal_AI='/Dev1/PFI0',
        mode_AI='labscript', # 'labscript', 'gated', 'triggered'
        sample_rate_AI=1000,
        num_PFI=0
)
```

As can be seen, every current feature of this device is specified in its initialization, removing the need for many classes dedicated to essentially the same NI board.
values.title: JQI generic NI board class

summary.raw:
I have added the generic NI class that we use at the JQI.  I also took the time to find all (most?) of the bug fixes that have been applied to other NI cards over the past year and get them into this class.  This change required a small number of changes to the NIboard class to give it instance rather than class level variables, and I also changed some variable names to be more consistent across the board.

This in turn required some changes in all of the remaining NI boards.   It is probable that I have introduced some bugs in the process of doing this, and I don't have ready access to hardware to test.

The syntax of this new class is:

```

```

As can be seen, every current feature of this device is specified in its initialization, removing the need for many classes dedicated to essentially the same NI board.
summary.html:
I have added the generic NI class that we use at the JQI. I also took the time to find all (most?) of the bug fixes that have been applied to other NI cards over the past year and get them into this class. This change required a small number of changes to the NIboard class to give it instance rather than class level variables, and I also changed some variable names to be more consistent across the board.

This in turn required some changes in all of the remaining NI boards. It is probable that I have introduced some bugs in the process of doing this, and I don't have ready access to hardware to test.

The syntax of this new class is:

from labscript_devices.NI_DAQmx import NI_DAQmx

NI_DAQmx(name='ni_pci_6733_0', parent_device=pulseblaster_0_ni_pci_clock,
        MAX_name='Dev1',
        clock_terminal='/Dev1/RTSI0', 
        num_AO=8,
        sample_rate_AO=700e3,
        num_DO=8,
        sample_rate_DO=2e6,
        num_AI=0,
        clock_terminal_AI='/Dev1/PFI0',
        mode_AI='labscript', # 'labscript', 'gated', 'triggered'
        sample_rate_AI=1000,
        num_PFI=0
)

As can be seen, every current feature of this device is specified in its initialization, removing the need for many classes dedicated to essentially the same NI board.

values.description:
I've changed the layout of the status area of the PulseBlaster tab to be more like the original gtk version, with the addition of icons. This resolves issue #21

Note that I have not tested with the no DDS version, however the changes should be identical. The other versions of PulseBlasters subclass one of the two modified here, so don't need changing.

![PulseBlaster Status.PNG](data/bitbucket.org/repo/dedbbp/images/4172177158-PulseBlaster_Status.PNG)

values.description:
Added workaround for old pulseblasters which do not report their status and as such have no way to detect end-of-run. End-of-run is now based on a fixed duration equal to the shot duration plus some extra time to account for waits and software delays.

This change is backward compatible.
values.title: time based shot duration workaround for old pulseblasters

summary.raw:
Added workaround for old pulseblasters which do not report their status and as such have no way to detect end-of-run. End-of-run is now based on a fixed duration equal to the shot duration plus some extra time to account for waits and software delays.

This change is backward compatible.
summary.html:
Added workaround for old pulseblasters which do not report their status and as such have no way to detect end-of-run. End-of-run is now based on a fixed duration equal to the shot duration plus some extra time to account for waits and software delays.

This change is backward compatible.

values.description:
This pull request along with it's sister pull requests introduces qtutil's new abstraction layer for Qt. This abstraction layer is supposed to act like PyQt5. A few adjustments needed to be made so things don't break.

This pull request should also bring PyQt5 compatibility but this should be experimental at first so reviewing should not include this as a criterium for approval. (This has been discussed [here](https://pstarkey.github.io/bitbucket-archive/#!/pull-requests/1/pyqt5/diff#comment-41775691))

To test this one needs to also pull from my qtutils repo [here](https://bitbucket.org/PhyNerd/qtutils/).
values.title: qtutils 2.0.0 support and experimental PyQt5 support

summary.raw:
This pull request along with it's sister pull requests introduces qtutil's new abstraction layer for Qt. This abstraction layer is supposed to act like PyQt5. A few adjustments needed to be made so things don't break.

This pull request should also bring PyQt5 compatibility but this should be experimental at first so reviewing should not include this as a criterium for approval. (This has been discussed [here](https://pstarkey.github.io/bitbucket-archive/#!/pull-requests/1/pyqt5/diff#comment-41775691))

To test this one needs to also pull from my qtutils repo [here](https://bitbucket.org/PhyNerd/qtutils/).
summary.html:
This pull request along with it's sister pull requests introduces qtutil's new abstraction layer for Qt. This abstraction layer is supposed to act like PyQt5. A few adjustments needed to be made so things don't break.

This pull request should also bring PyQt5 compatibility but this should be experimental at first so reviewing should not include this as a criterium for approval. (This has been discussed here)

To test this one needs to also pull from my qtutils repo here.

values.description:
I added a new device property to the Camera class to allow setting and
tracking of the read out sensor area on a per shot basis.
There is a new method, set_acquisition_ROI, that sets the new propery
while sweeping some of set_property's features under the rug.
The idea is that the acquisition_ROI will be set at the top of a script by
calling set_acquisition_ROI, which permits changing of the sensor area
on each shot without breaking due to connection table conflicts. The
acquisition_ROI can be set using globals from runmanager and will be
stored into the shot's h5 file.

DSB

P.S. This feature is designed to play well with a camera server, which
I will request to be pulled into labscript_utils later this week.
values.title: New Camera property: acquisition_ROI

summary.raw:
I added a new device property to the Camera class to allow setting and
tracking of the read out sensor area on a per shot basis.
There is a new method, set_acquisition_ROI, that sets the new propery
while sweeping some of set_property's features under the rug.
The idea is that the acquisition_ROI will be set at the top of a script by
calling set_acquisition_ROI, which permits changing of the sensor area
on each shot without breaking due to connection table conflicts. The
acquisition_ROI can be set using globals from runmanager and will be
stored into the shot's h5 file.

P.S. This feature is designed to play well with a camera server, which

summary.html:
I added a new device property to the Camera class to allow setting and tracking of the read out sensor area on a per shot basis. There is a new method, set_acquisition_ROI, that sets the new propery while sweeping some of set_property's features under the rug. The idea is that the acquisition_ROI will be set at the top of a script by calling set_acquisition_ROI, which permits changing of the sensor area on each shot without breaking due to connection table conflicts. The acquisition_ROI can be set using globals from runmanager and will be stored into the shot's h5 file.

DSB

P.S. This feature is designed to play well with a camera server, which I will request to be pulled into labscript_utils later this week.

values.description:
This is the first step to making labscript devices Python 3 compatible.

I was not able to test most of these so there might still be loads of bugs/problems here.

* added future imports to **init**.py and some brackets
* Future imports in all files, print ->print\(\), exec -> exec\(\)
* Python3 compatibility changes
values.title: Python3

summary.raw:
This is the first step to making labscript devices Python 3 compatible.

I was not able to test most of these so there might still be loads of bugs/problems here.

* added future imports to **init**.py and some brackets
* Future imports in all files, print ->print\(\), exec -> exec\(\)
* Python3 compatibility changes
summary.html:
This is the first step to making labscript devices Python 3 compatible.

I was not able to test most of these so there might still be loads of bugs/problems here.

  • Future imports in all files, print ->print(), exec -> exec()
  • Python3 compatibility changes

values.description: Fixed bug of `RunviewerClass` of NovaTechDDS9M whereby dummy first instruction in asynchronous update\_mode was not being discarded, and thus plotted traces in runviewer were all one update behind, and missing the final update.
values.title: Novatech async bugfix

summary.raw: Fixed bug of `RunviewerClass` of NovaTechDDS9M whereby dummy first instruction in asynchronous update\_mode was not being discarded, and thus plotted traces in runviewer were all one update behind, and missing the final update.
summary.html: Fixed bug of RunviewerClass of NovaTechDDS9M whereby dummy first instruction in asynchronous update_mode was not being discarded, and thus plotted traces in runviewer were all one update behind, and missing the final update.

values.description:
This is a graft from the spielman fork, which I've done my best to isolate from other changes I'll make a separate pull request for.

This change introduces a 'default baudrate' setting for the Novatech. Basically, this is the baud rate you expect the Novatech to be in when you power it on, and when you don't have one of the models where you can change a jumper to make them always at the fastest speed.
If you use this setting, the novatech will be told at startup to switch from its default baudrate to the one BLACS will actually talk to it with, and then the serial connection restarted with the new baudrate. Then at shutdown, the novatech is set back to its default baudrate, which is also nice if you don't want to confuse other software that needs to talk to the novatech and has expectations about its baudrate.
values.title: Novatech default baudrate

This is a graft from the spielman fork, which I've done my best to isolate from other changes I'll make a separate pull request for.

If you use this setting, the novatech will be told at startup to switch from its default baudrate to the one BLACS will actually talk to it with, and then the serial connection restarted with the new baudrate. Then at shutdown, the novatech is set back to its default baudrate, which is also nice if you don't want to confuse other software that needs to talk to the novatech and has expectations about its baudrate.

This is a graft from the spielman fork, which I've done my best to isolate from other changes I'll make a separate pull request for.

This change introduces a 'default baudrate' setting for the Novatech. Basically, this is the baud rate you expect the Novatech to be in when you power it on, and when you don't have one of the models where you can change a jumper to make them always at the fastest speed. If you use this setting, the novatech will be told at startup to switch from its default baudrate to the one BLACS will actually talk to it with, and then the serial connection restarted with the new baudrate. Then at shutdown, the novatech is set back to its default baudrate, which is also nice if you don't want to confuse other software that needs to talk to the novatech and has expectations about its baudrate.

values.description: Made novatech return a default unit conversion class for static channels too
values.title: Default unit conversions for novatech static channels

summary.raw: Made novatech return a default unit conversion class for static channels too
summary.html: Made novatech return a default unit conversion class for static channels too

values.description:
Workaround for problem where spurious PulseBlaster falling edges caused the novatech to advance its table, despite not being in table mode.

The workaround has it transition to table mode and back again, before going into
table mode for a buffered run. This "double clutch" mechanism appears to reset
its memory pointer to the start of the table. There may still be a potential race
condition in which the PulseBlaster gives its pulses after the double-clutch.
If so, A fix for this might entail imposing an ordering on the devices transitioning
to buffered.
values.title: Novatech "double clutch" workaround

summary.raw:
Workaround for problem where spurious PulseBlaster falling edges caused the novatech to advance its table, despite not being in table mode.

The workaround has it transition to table mode and back again, before going into
table mode for a buffered run. This "double clutch" mechanism appears to reset
its memory pointer to the start of the table. There may still be a potential race
condition in which the PulseBlaster gives its pulses after the double-clutch.
If so, A fix for this might entail imposing an ordering on the devices transitioning
to buffered.
summary.html:
Workaround for problem where spurious PulseBlaster falling edges caused the novatech to advance its table, despite not being in table mode.

The workaround has it transition to table mode and back again, before going into table mode for a buffered run. This "double clutch" mechanism appears to reset its memory pointer to the start of the table. There may still be a potential race condition in which the PulseBlaster gives its pulses after the double-clutch. If so, A fix for this might entail imposing an ordering on the devices transitioning to buffered.

values.description:
Add support for additional Novatech phase modes

This one also grafted over from Spielman fork.

Note to merger/future self, this one has an interaction with the "double clutch" since that one has extra lines setting the phase mode, make sure to get them when merging with it.
values.title: Novatech phase modes

summary.raw:
Add support for additional Novatech phase modes

This one also grafted over from Spielman fork.

Note to merger/future self, this one has an interaction with the "double clutch" since that one has extra lines setting the phase mode, make sure to get them when merging with it.
summary.html:
Add support for additional Novatech phase modes

This one also grafted over from Spielman fork.

Note to merger/future self, this one has an interaction with the "double clutch" since that one has extra lines setting the phase mode, make sure to get them when merging with it.

values.description:
Another from the Spielman fork.

Added option to duplicate the first line of the novatech's table in
synchronous output mode. This allows (or at least seems to allow, according
to our testing) phase coherent output when using a simple delay line for
synchronous output rather than a tri-state driver as Monash is using.
values.title: Novatech synchronous workaround

summary.raw:
Another from the Spielman fork.

Added option to duplicate the first line of the novatech's table in
synchronous output mode. This allows (or at least seems to allow, according
to our testing) phase coherent output when using a simple delay line for
synchronous output rather than a tri-state driver as Monash is using.
summary.html:
Another from the Spielman fork.

Added option to duplicate the first line of the novatech's table in synchronous output mode. This allows (or at least seems to allow, according to our testing) phase coherent output when using a simple delay line for synchronous output rather than a tri-state driver as Monash is using.

values.description:
* Attempt to implement multiple connection attempts and web server restart on the rfBlaster. This requires respawning netcat upon each connection. Standalone test script in RFBlaster\_kloned.py. New method restart\_kloned called by all methods that make urllib2.urlopen calls; transition\_to\_buffered, check\_remote\_values, & program\_manual. A fair bit of boilerplate here, with the only thing differing being the actual request.
* RFBlaster changes:

    * Use logging from labscript\_utils.
    * Fix global import of socket in **init**.
    * Fix attempt to netcat using self.address, which had protocol prefix and port.
    * Fixed reconnect loop \(while should only be conditional on whether it worked\).
    * Reset connection attempts after successful kloned restart over netcat.
    
* RFBlaster: Better handling of socket errors, and logging specific exceptions.

‌
values.title: RFBlaster stability improvements

summary.raw:
* Attempt to implement multiple connection attempts and web server restart on the rfBlaster. This requires respawning netcat upon each connection. Standalone test script in RFBlaster\_kloned.py. New method restart\_kloned called by all methods that make urllib2.urlopen calls; transition\_to\_buffered, check\_remote\_values, & program\_manual. A fair bit of boilerplate here, with the only thing differing being the actual request.
* RFBlaster changes:

    * Use logging from labscript\_utils.
    * Fix global import of socket in **init**.
    * Fix attempt to netcat using self.address, which had protocol prefix and port.
    * Fixed reconnect loop \(while should only be conditional on whether it worked\).
    * Reset connection attempts after successful kloned restart over netcat.
    
* RFBlaster: Better handling of socket errors, and logging specific exceptions.

‌
summary.html:
• Attempt to implement multiple connection attempts and web server restart on the rfBlaster. This requires respawning netcat upon each connection. Standalone test script in RFBlaster_kloned.py. New method restart_kloned called by all methods that make urllib2.urlopen calls; transition_to_buffered, check_remote_values, & program_manual. A fair bit of boilerplate here, with the only thing differing being the actual request.

  • RFBlaster changes:

    • Use logging from labscript_utils.
    • Fix global import of socket in init.
    • Fix attempt to netcat using self.address, which had protocol prefix and port.
    • Fixed reconnect loop (while should only be conditional on whether it worked).
    • Reset connection attempts after successful kloned restart over netcat.

  • RFBlaster: Better handling of socket errors, and logging specific exceptions.

‌

values.description:
Runs in gui-less BLACS tab.

Card parameters are configured in connection table. 

Assumes a single acquisition during a shot.

Acquires to RAM, subsequently writes to H5 file, so is limited by available RAM.

Currently only supports triggered acquision, where one trigger prompts recording of pre-defined sample duration.

Record channel A, or channels A&B, but not channel B only. No code yet for cards with other than 2 channels.

Saves to H5 as raw samples and as floating point in volts.

Saves metadata as attributes in devices section, but largely encodes metadata at ATS API bitfields rather than transparent scientific quantitites.

Substantial debugging output on BLACS console.

Recovers from aborts successfully and continues.

Promptly throws exception leading to red-text traceback in both BLACS-tab windows, if the trigger is not received by the end of the shot \(transition-to-manual time\).
values.title: Support for AlazarTech data acquisition cards (ATS9462 and potentially others)

summary.raw:
Runs in gui-less BLACS tab.

Card parameters are configured in connection table. 

Assumes a single acquisition during a shot.

Acquires to RAM, subsequently writes to H5 file, so is limited by available RAM.

Currently only supports triggered acquision, where one trigger prompts recording of pre-defined sample duration.

Record channel A, or channels A&B, but not channel B only. No code yet for cards with other than 2 channels.

Saves to H5 as raw samples and as floating point in volts.

Saves metadata as attributes in devices section, but largely encodes metadata at ATS API bitfields rather than transparent scientific quantitites.

Substantial debugging output on BLACS console.

Recovers from aborts successfully and continues.

Promptly throws exception leading to red-text traceback in both BLACS-tab windows, if the trigger is not received by the end of the shot \(transition-to-manual time\).
summary.html:
Runs in gui-less BLACS tab.

Card parameters are configured in connection table.

Assumes a single acquisition during a shot.

Acquires to RAM, subsequently writes to H5 file, so is limited by available RAM.

Currently only supports triggered acquision, where one trigger prompts recording of pre-defined sample duration.

Record channel A, or channels A&B, but not channel B only. No code yet for cards with other than 2 channels.

Saves to H5 as raw samples and as floating point in volts.

Saves metadata as attributes in devices section, but largely encodes metadata at ATS API bitfields rather than transparent scientific quantitites.

Substantial debugging output on BLACS console.

Recovers from aborts successfully and continues.

Promptly throws exception leading to red-text traceback in both BLACS-tab windows, if the trigger is not received by the end of the shot (transition-to-manual time).

values.description:
A basic implementation of a DLP LighCrafter Digital Micromirror Device evaluation board. Allows 1-bit bmps to be displayed on the DMD in manual mode, and a sequence of images to be loaded to step through in buffered mode.

Has been tested on up to date versions of BLACS & labscript\_devices, and I have attempted to implement the Python 3 forwards compatibility patches that are being rolled out to other devices.

Requires [BLACS pull request 48 “Add basic support for Image output types”](#!/labscript_suite/blacs/pull-requests/48/add-basic-support-for-image-output-types/diff)
values.title: LightCrafter

summary.raw:
A basic implementation of a DLP LighCrafter Digital Micromirror Device evaluation board. Allows 1-bit bmps to be displayed on the DMD in manual mode, and a sequence of images to be loaded to step through in buffered mode.

Has been tested on up to date versions of BLACS & labscript\_devices, and I have attempted to implement the Python 3 forwards compatibility patches that are being rolled out to other devices.

Requires [BLACS pull request 48 “Add basic support for Image output types”](#!/labscript_suite/blacs/pull-requests/48/add-basic-support-for-image-output-types/diff)
summary.html:
A basic implementation of a DLP LighCrafter Digital Micromirror Device evaluation board. Allows 1-bit bmps to be displayed on the DMD in manual mode, and a sequence of images to be loaded to step through in buffered mode.

Has been tested on up to date versions of BLACS & labscript_devices, and I have attempted to implement the Python 3 forwards compatibility patches that are being rolled out to other devices.

Requires BLACS pull request 48 “Add basic support for Image output types”

values.description:
Have wait monitors post events when each wait is complete.
Minor version bump so that others may depend on this.
This is intended for use by a shot progress bar plugin for BLACS, the progress bar will pause during a wait.

This needs testing! I have not tested it. I might get a chance to, though.

Note to self: tag the commit with the version number once merged.

summary.html:
Have wait monitors post events when each wait is complete. Minor version bump so that others may depend on this. This is intended for use by a shot progress bar plugin for BLACS, the progress bar will pause during a wait.

This needs testing! I have not tested it. I might get a chance to, though.

Note to self: tag the commit with the version number once merged.

values.description:
Added Dimitri's imaqdx camera server, with my recent modifications implementing abort().

This server has been in use at JQI for some time. It is Python 3 only - typically we run the camera server in Python 3 even though it talks to the rest of the system running in Python 2.

It seems like it maybe has a significant memory leak that should be looked into. I don't see anything immediately obvious, which makes me suspect it might be the underlying imaqdx Python or C library and not actually this code's fault - nonethless may be important to figure out how to work around.

I figure this probably belongs more in labscript_devices than in labscript_utils, since it is related to devices.
values.title: Imaqdx server

summary.raw:
Added Dimitri's imaqdx camera server, with my recent modifications implementing abort().

This server has been in use at JQI for some time. It is Python 3 only - typically we run the camera server in Python 3 even though it talks to the rest of the system running in Python 2.

It seems like it maybe has a significant memory leak that should be looked into. I don't see anything immediately obvious, which makes me suspect it might be the underlying imaqdx Python or C library and not actually this code's fault - nonethless may be important to figure out how to work around.

I figure this probably belongs more in labscript_devices than in labscript_utils, since it is related to devices.
summary.html:
Added Dimitri's imaqdx camera server, with my recent modifications implementing abort().

This server has been in use at JQI for some time. It is Python 3 only - typically we run the camera server in Python 3 even though it talks to the rest of the system running in Python 2.

It seems like it maybe has a significant memory leak that should be looked into. I don't see anything immediately obvious, which makes me suspect it might be the underlying imaqdx Python or C library and not actually this code's fault - nonethless may be important to figure out how to work around.

I figure this probably belongs more in labscript_devices than in labscript_utils, since it is related to devices.

values.title: Dummy IntermediateDevice

summary.html: Added dummy intermediate device so that you can test real pseudoclock devices without needing something to clock

values.description:
**This is mainly here to remind me to finish testing this**

Added tentative support for the Cicero pseudoclock that uses an Opal Kelly XEM3001 FPGA development board.

Firmware \(.bit files\) for the FPGA are available from [https://bitbucket.org/labscript\_suite/opalkellyxem3001/](#!/labscript_suite/opalkellyxem3001) and should be placed in the labscript\_devices folder for this to work. You also need to install the Opal Kelly SDK, which provides python bindings, and these Python bindings will need to be manually copied into the site-packages of any virtual environments you want to run BLACS from.

Things that need more testing:

* Using the external reference
* The inbuilt wait monitor
* That it can be substituted for another pseudoclock and the experiment sequence still has the same result \(aka, I’ve implemented it correctly!\)
values.title: Cicero Opal Kelly XEM3001 pseudoclock
